action.action-desc: Mr. Balderson (for himself and Mr. Buchanan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide coverage of certain technologies and medical devices under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Innovation for Seniors Act.

section.header: Coverage of certain technologies and medical devices
section.text: Section 1852(a)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–22(a)(3) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking subparagraph (D) and inserting subparagraphs (D) and (E); and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Coverage of certain technologies and medical devices

clause.text: For plan year 2025 and subsequent plan years, in addition to any supplemental health care benefits otherwise provided under this paragraph, an MA plan, including a specialized MA plan for special needs individuals (as defined in section 1859(b)(6)), may provide the supplemental benefits described in clause (ii).

subclause.text: The supplemental benefits described in this clause are as follows:

item.text: A medical device or technology that has a national coverage determination or local coverage determination under this title for an indication that is different than the indication for such coverage determination.
A technology that does not fit into another benefit category under this title.

subclause.text: The Secretary may, only with respect to supplemental benefits provided under this subparagraph, waive the uniformity requirements under this part, as determined appropriate by the Secretary.
